Key Arguments: The government should not have the final say on truth, as it could lead to a lack of accountability.
There is a lack of clarity on how ACMA will determine the adequacy of a code of conduct, which could lead to biased decisions.
The government itself has contributed to misinformation, particularly during the COVID pandemic, by not being transparent about statistics.
The proposed legislation could lead to over-censorship and impose additional costs on media platforms, which would be passed on to consumers.
The industry is already taking steps to reduce misinformation, making government intervention unnecessary.
Main Themes: Economic impact on media platforms and consumers
Existing industry efforts to combat misinformation
Notable Quotes: At no time is the Government to have the last say on truth.
I consider the presentation of COVID deaths by the government as misinformation, and it would be appropriate for the government to be called out the same way as everyone else.
No media platform could survive with the continuous threat of large fines.
